basics.name: Kelly Nelson
basics.label: Web Developer
basics.summary: My cumulation of life decisions has me as a web developer with one eye always on design. Currently, I'm focused on developing in the VueJS and ReactJS frameworks but I'm hungry to contribute to any project in a meaningful way. I love to learn new technologies and add to my toolbelt. I enjoy working in teams but also know the importance of working independently. I'm humble enough to know my limitations, but that also provides my drive to be better.

work.summary: Co-designed and developed the front end of a player's hub web app, as well as a cryptocurrency wallet system, for a blockchain based gaming ecosystem. I leveraged frameworks such as VueJS, VueX and Tachyons CSS along with consuming the Gamesparks SDK and varioius API's for player auth, game data and account administration. Participated in UI design reviews, sprint reviews, and retrospectives. Managed sprint tasks and goals in Waffle and Github. Maintained existing corporate websites, using HTML/Bootstrap/JS with the Jekyll development framework.

Dedicated front end web developer on contract (Modis) for the Thermal Imaging marketing group, building HTML/CSS/JS landing pages and emails for product launches, including maintaining 60+ global product websites in 30+ languages through various content management systems in a fast paced environment with tight deadlines. Working in systems such as JIRA, Eloqua, MS CMS, Clickability, Drupal and CRM.

Acquire, design and build out a 1964 Airstream into a mobile walk-in coffee shop, manage the business operations of a retail coffee shop including purchasing, accounting, inventory planning, cash handling, enthusiastic hospitality, customer education and marketing.

Administration/support of various systems including Windows based desktops, servers (including virtual), Active Directory, iOS/Android devices, VOIP system (Avaya), Building Security systems (Kantech), Asset Inventory system (Footprints), LAN hardware (Juniper), Video Surveillance (Milestone/IQInvision), various industry related applications (Clevest, TWACS, Itron), server room redesign including redundant power distribution, rack space design, cable/patch panel management and environmental monitoring.

Dedicated on-site contractor for EDS at Weyerhaeuser doing Windows 2000/NT domain user account creations, deletions and administration using Active Directory, Exchange mailbox creations, deletions and administration using Active Directory and Exchange Administrator, group security permissions, share creations, break/fix resolutions, documentation.
Administration/support of enterprise Windows based desktops (2,000), servers (100+), NT accounts, printers, Exchange accounts, IIS, asset tracking, etc.

volunteer.summary: Help guide 7-9 year olds through a week of camp activities while teaching biblical concepts in ways they can understand and utilize after leaving camp.
Help guide older teenagers through a week of camp activities while teaching biblical concepts that will help them navigate the responsibilities that come with the transition to adulthood.

courses: How to Use Git and Github

portfolio.name: Monopoly Calculator
portfolio.summary: Web app for Monopoly to calculate the total net worth of a Monopoly game winner. Built with Create-React-App and deployed through Surge.sh

portfolio.name: Hymns Background
portfolio.summary: Web app that allows for page and title searching of hymns from various church hymnals. Version 1 was Built with MeanJS scaffolding and deployed to EC2 on AWS using a Bitnami MEAN stack. Version 2, the current version, was refactored using VueJs, VueX and JSON data.

portfolio.name: Kelly Nelson Photography
portfolio.summary: My own website displaying my photography work through a Flickr API. Contact email form using NodeJS server (ExpressJS) hosted on Heroku. Built with HJS-Webpack/React and deployed to Surge.sh

portfolio.name: My Reads
portfolio.summary: A responsive web app that allows users to select and catagorize books into a virtual bookshelf. Leveraged React to support a dynamic user interface that interacts with an API server and client library. This was a project built during Udacity's React Nanodegree program.

portfolio.name: Tri-Cities Launch
portfolio.summary: Informational single page website for the 2016 version of Tri-Cities Launch.
